text: The Atelopus ignescens is a species of toad. It is often known as the Jambato toad or the Quito stubfoot toad. They belong to the family Bufonidae. They live in Ecuador. They were thought to be extinct until some were discovered in 2016. Their habitat is subtropical or tropical high-altitude. It was believed to be the closest relative of the Carrikeri Harlequin Frog. == References == == Books == * Ron, S., Coloma, L.A., Lötters, S., Duellman, W., Bustamante, M.R., Bolívar, W. & La Marca, E. 2004. Atelopus ignescens . 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 21 July 2007. Category:Toads Category:Frogs of South America
title: Atelopus ignescens
